alert.note: Alert for Broward (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 02 at 6:39PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the following county, Broward. * WHEN...Until 745 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 636 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated that the rains have ended in the Advisory area. However, rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches with up to 6 inches in the Weston area have fallen from from the previous showers and thunderstorms. This amount of rainfall will take some time to drain away due to the grounds being already saturated from previous storm the last couple of days. Therefore, the Flood Advisory will remain in effect until 745 PM EDT this evening. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pembroke Pines, Hollywood, Coral Springs, Davie, Plantation, Sunrise, Tamarac, Margate, Lauderhill, Weston, North Lauderdale, Cooper City, Sawgrass Mills Mall, Pine Island Ridge, Intersection I-75 And Griffin Road, Sunshine Acres, Nova Southeastern University, Royal Palm Ranches, Markham Park and Downtown Davie. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
